title: mishy
body:
A mascot character of [[falcom|Nihon Falcom]]. Cat-like creature with white and gray tuxedo pattern. Always stands in the form of a human and never crawls on its paws. 

Initially was introduced in the [[eiyuu densetsu|Kiseki series]] as mascot character of Mishelam Wonderland in [[zero_no_kiseki|Zero]] and [[Ao no Kiseki]]. In-game appears as [[stuffed_animal|plushie]] and sold as merch.

Also appears as a cameo of sorts in [[Nayuta no Kiseki]] and [[Ys viii: lacrimosa of dana|Ys 8]].

h4. See also

* [[Tio Plato]], huge Mishy fan.

title: barbie:_a_fashion_fairytale
body:
An 3D animated movie released in 2010 starring [[Barbie (character)|]]. This movie features Barbie as an actress, recontextualizing many of the other animated movies as her previous work. After a movie production goes awry and she's duped into believing [[Ken (barbie)|]] broke up with her over the phone, she decides to fly to [[Paris]] to meet with her aunt Millicent. Upon arriving, she learns her aunt's fashion studio is at risk of shutting down and being bought out, and with the help of some magical "flairies" puts on a fashion show to save it.

[[Barbie: A Fairy Secret]] is a direct continuation of this film's characters and setting.

title: toon_(style)
body:
Artwork in the style of typical Western animation and comics. This includes styles based on classic [[Disney]] or [[Warner Bros.]] cartoons, modern cartoons such as [[The Simpsons]], [[Family Guy]], or [[South Park]], as well as styles from superhero, newspaper, or indie/underground comics.

While there are some Japanese characters that resemble toons, such as the casts of [[Sazae-san]] and [[Anpanman]], they do not count under this tag by default.

This tag is meant for characters who are drawn in the style of cartoons, [b]not[/b] for pictures of a character who merely originated from one.

h4. Substyles

* [[1930s (style)]] - Commonly referred to as "Inkblot" or "Rubberhose"
* [[western comics (style)|]] - Characters drawn in the style of American superhero comics; also known as "Amecomi"

h4. See also

* [[cartoonized]] - Non-cartoon characters drawn in the Toon style
* [[animification]] - Includes Western characters drawn in the style of anime and manga
* [[List of style parodies]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Toon":[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Toon]

title: who_framed_roger_rabbit
body:
A 1988 film that combines live action with animation in a world where cartoon characters (such as those of [[Disney]] and [[Warner Bros.]]) physically exist in real life. As the title suggests, the film is about the toon [[Roger Rabbit]] being accused of murder. To clear his name, he must seek the help of [[Eddie Valiant]], a former famous detective turned cynical after the death of his brother and partner.

title: mortal_kombat_(series)
body:
A series of fighting games initially developed by Midway Games, starting in 1992 for the Sega Genesis, SNES and arcades. It has grown infamous for its violent Fatality finishers, which were so graphic that it helped lead to the creation of the Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB) and the ratings systems used today for video games.

Since Midway's takeover by [[Warner Bros.]] in 2006, the studio was reorganized into Netherealm Studios, which has continued to develop the series since. Later games have become known for featuring guest characters from various properties, ranging from comic books to Hollywood horror franchises.

In Japan, after Mortal Kombat Trilogy on PS1 in 1998, official releases largely stopped due to lack of popularity, with the mobile release of Mortal Kombat X since 2015 presenting an exception before games were available to Japanese via online platforms again.

h4. Tagged games

* [[Mortal Kombat Trilogy]] (1996)
* [[Mortal Kombat 4]] (1997)
* [[Mortal Kombat: Deception]] (2004)
* [[Mortal Kombat: Shaolin Monks]] (2005)
* [[Mortal Kombat vs DC Universe]] (2008)
* [[Mortal Kombat 9]] (2011)
* [[Mortal Kombat X]] (2015)
* [[Mortal Kombat 11]] (2019)
* [[Mortal Kombat 1 (2023)|]] (2023)

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Mortal Kombat":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mortal_Kombat

title: dune:_part_two
body:
[b]Dune: Part Two[/b] is a 2024 movie adaptation of the second half of the original [i][[dune_(series)|Dune]][/i] novel from the 60s, directed by "Denis Villeneuve":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Denis_Villeneuve. Originally scheduled for released on 3 November 2023 (after being delayed by [[coronavirus pandemic|COVID-19]]), it was pushed back due to the 2023 Writer's Guild of America and SAG-AFTRA strikes and was ultimately released on 1 March, 2024.

It is to be noted that while [[warner bros.|Warner Brothers]] has not confirmed it, Denis Villeneuve has stated that he is working to adapt the second book in the series -- [i]"Dune Messiah":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dune_Messiah[/i] -- into a sequel to the duology.

h4.See also

* [[Dune (2021 movie)]]
* [[Dune (series)]]

title: star_wars_resistance
body: [[Star Wars]] Resistance is an animated television series that premiered on October 7, 2018, and concluded on January 26, 2020, having aired on [[Disney]] Channel and Disney XD.

title: star_wars:_the_clone_wars
body:
[i][b]Star Wars: The Clone Wars[/b][/i] is an American [[3D]] CGI animated television series created by George Lucas and produced by Lucasfilm Animation, Lucasfilm and CGCG Inc., released in 2008. 

This [[science fiction]] and fantasy series began with a [[Star_Wars:_The_Clone_Wars_(movie)|theatrical feature film]] that was released on August 15, 2008, and debuted on Cartoon Network two months later on October 3, 2008.

The show is set in the fictional [[Star Wars]] galaxy during the three years between the prequel films [[Star Wars: Attack of the Clones|Episode II: Attack of the Clones]] and [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith|Episode III: Revenge of the Sith]]. It follows the course of the titular conflict through the lens of various characters as they deal with the war's impact upon them.

The Clone Wars was a massive ratings success, becoming one of [[Cartoon Network|Cartoon Network's]] highest rated shows during its initial run. Throughout its run, the series received mostly positive reception from critics, receiving praise for its writing, action, characters, visuals, voice acting, music, scale and tone. 

The series has also garnered a massive fan following and has also been nominated for many USA entertainment industry awards, including the Daytime Emmy Awards and the Annie Awards. 

Not to be confused with the 2003 series, [[Star Wars: Clone Wars]], which was 2D animated and was declared as non-canon after Disney acquired the franchise.

h4. See also

* [[Anakin Skywalker]]
* [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]]
* [[Ahsoka Tano]]

h4. Sequels

* [[Star Wars Rebels]]

* [[Star Wars: The Bad Batch]]

His design is based on "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie 's discarded original design for [[Chewbacca]] in the first Star Wars film from the 70s.

title: mustafar
body:
A [[Star Wars]] planet, [b]Mustafar[/b] is a tiny, fiery planet in the Outer Rim, Mustafar maintains an erratic orbit between two gas giants. Mustafar is rich in unique and valuable minerals which have long been mined by the Tech Union. Its lava pits and rivers make this planet a dangerous habitat; its natives have burly, tough bodies that can withstand extreme heat. The planet became the backdrop for the fateful duel between [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker]]. After the rise of the [[galactic empire (star wars)|Empire]], captured Jedi were brought to the volcanic world for interrogation and execution.

H6. Appearances
* [[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith]]
* [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]]
* [[Star Wars Rebels]]
* [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]]
* [[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker]]

title: mon_mothma
body: Mon Mothma is a fictional character in the [[Star Wars]] franchise, primarily portrayed by Genevieve O'Reilly. Introduced as the leader of the Rebel Alliance in [[star wars: return of The Jedi|Return of the Jedi]] (1983), in which she is played by Caroline Blakiston, Mon has become a prominent character in subsequent prequel media, including the anthology film Rogue One (2016), the animated series [[star wars: the clone warS|The Clone Wars]] (2010) and [[star wars rebels|Star Wars Rebels]] (2017), and the live-action television series Andor (2022–present). The character also appeared in the 2023 live-action television series Ahsoka, again portrayed by O'Reilly, her first time playing the character in sequel media set after Return of the Jedi.

title: sabine_wren
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Star Wars]] series.

[b]Sabine Wren[/b] is one of the main protagonists of the [[Star Wars Rebels]] animated TV series released in 2014.

She is an intrepid [[Mandalorian]] warrior. Her weapons of choice are dual blaster pistols.

title: saw_gerrera
body:
A character from the [[Star Wars]] science fiction series.

He first appears in the [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]] cartoon series, and later returns in the [[Rogue One: A Star Wars Story]] Anthology film from 2016, where he is portrayed by Forest Whitaker. Whitaker would later reprise his role as the character by performing as his [[voice actor|voice actor]] in both the third season of [[Star Wars Rebels]] and the [[Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order]] video game.

[b]Saw Gerrera[/b] is the founder and current leader of the [[partisan_(star_wars)|Partisans]], a rebel group opposed to the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]].

title: star_wars_rebels
body:
[b][i]Star Wars: Rebels[/i][/b] is an American [[3D]] CGI animated television series produced by Lucasfilm Animation and released in 2014.  It is a sequel to [[Star Wars: The Clone Wars]].

It premiered as a 44-minute film, [i]Star Wars Rebels: Spark of Rebellion[/i], on October 3, 2014 on Disney Channel prior to the official premiere of the series on October 13 on Disney XD. So far 2 seasons have been released in 2014 and 2015, with a third season coming in September 24, 2016.

The show is set 14 years after [i]Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith[/i] and five years before [i]Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope[/i]. 

[i]Rebels[/i] takes place during an era when the [[Galactic Empire (star Wars)|]] is securing its grip on the galaxy. Imperial forces are hunting down the last of the [[Jedi]] Knights while a fledgling [[Rebel Alliance (star Wars)|]] against the Empire is taking form. 

Most of the visual style of Star Wars Rebels is notable because it is inspired by the [[Star Wars]] original trilogy concept art by "Ralph McQuarrie":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_McQuarrie .

A Japanese webcomic adapting the series began publication in 2019. The adaptation features art by [[Aoki Akira]] and is published by [[Line (naver)|]] in Japan, while physical volumes are translated and published overseas by Yen Press.

h4. See also

* [[Ezra Bridger]]
* [[Kanan Jarrus]]

* [[ghost_(spaceship)|Ghost]]

title: dimitri_alexandre_blaiddyd
body:
Main character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and the leader of the Blue Lions.

Being the crown prince of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus, he presents himself as a chivalrous and honorable young man. However, a sense of darkness lies beneath his noble demeanor.

He is childhood friends with [[Felix Hugo Fraldarius|Felix]], [[Ingrid Brandl Galatea|Ingrid]] and [[Sylvain Jose Gautier|Sylvain]].

Voiced by: Chris Hackney (English), [[Ishikawa Kaito]] (Japanese).

title: blacked_(phrase)
body:
A raceplay fetish that consists of a [[dark-skinned male|black man]] having [[sex]] with an individual of [[interracial|another ethnicity]], usually a white woman (which is called a snowbunny). 

Named after an American porn website.

A noticeable [[meme attire]] is the black-and-white underwear with the "BLACKED" text. See post #2999241 and post #3281004

This tag is primarily used when the text "BLACKED" is seen on clothing, accessories, tattoos, or itself as a logo or title. For other posts involving general interracial fetish, use [[interracial]] instead.

h4.See also
* [[Queen of Spades symbol]]
* [[bleached (phrase)]], the opposite.

body:
A controllable character from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

[[Chrom (fire emblem)|Chrom]]'s lieutenant, an Ylissean knight who is sincere to a fault. He tends to demand tremendous effort for seemingly trivial things, and prefaces such exercises with a grin. The fondest of starting fires. Born on August 26th.

title: lissa_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Lissa[/b] (リズ, [i]Liz[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

She is [[Chrom (fire emblem)|]]'s younger sister and [[Lucina (fire emblem)|]]'s aunt. She is one of the first members of the Shepherds the player meets. Although being a princess, she shows absolutely no aristocratic behavior, unlike her best friend, [[Maribelle_(fire_emblem)|]].

title: yunaka_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character from [[Fire Emblem Engage]], known for her peppy attitude and tendency to use strange phrases, such as “hiya papaya” when greeting someone, or “zappy” to express interest. She’s also the initial user of [[Micaiah (Fire Emblem)|]]’s ring after attempting to steal it.

[spoiler]Her true name is Larimar, an assassin known for her stoic, heartless demeanor. Yunaka’s “fake” personality is both an attempt to hide this dark side of her and to move on from it.[/spoiler]

She has [[long hair|long]], [[red hair]], with black and white [[star (symbol)|]] symbols on her face and hair ([[star facial mark]], [[star hair ornament]]), and wears a purple [[unitard]] with a yellow [[belt]].

Voiced by [[Fairouz Ai]] in the Japanese version (who also voiced [[Phina (Fire Emblem)|]] in the same series), and by [[Laura Post]] in the English version (who also voiced [[Silvia (Fire Emblem)|]] and [[Catherine (Fire Emblem)|]] in the same series.)

title: konpaku_youmu_(ghost)
body:
The [[ghost]] half of [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]]. 

Although the English-speaking fandom often uses "[[myon_(phrase)|Myon]]" to call her [[ghost]]-half, it was derived from the Japanese fandom where it refers to [[Konpaku Youmu]] herself. For the sake of consistency, Myon has been aliased to this tag to prevent confusion.

title: saber_alter_(third_ascension)
body:
[[Saber Alter]] in her third ascension costume from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. Instead of her [[black armor]] she wears a [[long dress|long]] [[black dress|black]]/[[purple dress]] with a [[Juliet sleeves|Juliet sleeved]] [[shrug (clothing)|]], a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]], and a pair of [[detached sleeves]] underneath the shrug. It was originally designed for a "Dollfie Dream doll":[https://www.volks.co.jp/jp/fate_ex/saber_alter.html/] as part of [[TYPE-MOON]]'s 10th anniversary. It would later be featured in the [[Heaven's Feel]] animated adaptations by [[ufotable]].

It's common for artists to mix-and-match elements of this ascension with her final ascension. If elements from both are visible, tag both ascensions.

Not to be confused with her [[Saber Alter (gothic Lolita)|Gothic Lolita]] costume or her [[Saber Alter (swimsuit rider) (third ascension)|Alter Rider Swimsuit's third ascension]].

title: han'ei_no_chocolate_gardens_of_valentine
body:
[b]Valentine's 2018 ~The Bountiful Chocolate Gardens of Valentine~[/b]
[quote]The battle has already begun...
For some, it began the moment they decided to convey their feelings through a gift of chocolate.
For some, it began the moment they decided to make the chocolates that will be the vessel of their wish.
For some, it began the moment they shed tears of frustration over ungiven chocolates last year.
They now lay the groundwork for victory in the once-a-year battle called "Valentine's Day."

And one girl prepares to step into the battlefield for the first time ...[/quote]

title: nero_matsuri
body:
[b]Nero Fest ~The Colosseum of Victory~[/b]
[quote]
[b]The time is now!!!![/b]
Rejoice, my beloved Roman citizen!
Be prosper and enjoy, the ample and extravagant Rome!
I hereby announce the start of the new Olympia, the start of Nero Fest!
In the Colosseum built especially for this day, display your might, grasp glory and reward with your own hands!
[/quote]
The first limited-time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first held on the Japanese server starting on September 16, 2015 and on the NA server on July 25, 2017. It would have reruns with new Craft Essences and additional story scenes three times, in 2016, 2017, and 2021.

title: kumi_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character from [[Senran Kagura New Wave]].

[b]Kumi[/b] has Fox characteristics to her appearance, these mainly being her [[fox ears]] and [[multiple tails|nine]] [[fox tail]]s which she uses to hold each weapon she uses in battle.

A member of the Touno Tengu Ninja Squad and a third-year high school student.

She fights by using her nine tails to wield a variety of weapons.

Freewheeling, aggressive, and always seeming close to blowing her top, she's the very model of a "problem child."  That said, when it comes to the weak or people who are relying on her, she's got a big-sisterly disposition.  She'll take care of them to the last, though she'll complain while doing it.

The team's usual pattern goes something like this:  Kumi will tease Misato until they start fighting. [[Yuyaki (senran kagura)|]] will then intervene and try to mediate.  When Yuyaki seems on the verge of losing it, the still-impatient Kumi and [[Misato (senran kagura)|]] end up teaming up to stop her.

Age: 17
Gender: Female
Blood Type: Type-B
Birthday: July, 27th (Leo)
Favorite Food: Fox Udon

Hair Color: [[orange hair|Light Orange]]
Eye Color: [[red eyes|Red]]
Height: 166cm (5'5")
Bust: 87cm (34") ([[large breasts|E cup]])
Waist: 60cm (24")
Hips: 87cm (34")

Voiced by [[MAKIKO (Voice actor)|]]

title: yomi_(senran_kagura)
body:
[[Senran Kagura]] [[senran kagura shoujo-tachi no shin'ei|Shoujo-tachi no Shin'ei]] character. A second-year Shinobi at the Hebijo Academy.

Yomi has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with flat [[bangs]] and a small green [[hairclip]]. After transforming into a Shinobi, she wears a [[maid]]-like outfit consisting of a blue-green [[dress]] with white slip. The top of it comes to her bust, with a white collar around her neck. She wears long [[white gloves]], and a blue-green [[beret]] with a [[bow]] on the back. She wears [[white thighhighs]] under her dress.

Yomi is often seen with her signature large [[sword]] and arm-mounted [[crossbow]] launcher, reminiscent of [[Guts (berserk)|]] from [[Berserk]].

When her clothes are ripped off, she is revealed to be wearing a blue-green [[bikini skirt]] and bikini top.

title: master_and_servant
body:
Works wherein a servant, like a [[maid]] or [[butler]], are pictured with their master, the person or persons whom they service. This is usually hinted at through the way they dress, where one party is in uniform while the other is dressed as they please, or in aristocratic manner. 

If the servant is actively servicing a character who is not also dressed like a servant this is an even clearer example. Servicing could mean anything from [[cleaning]] to [[dressing another|helping another character get dressed]].

title: headless_instrument

title: bass_guitar
body: A plucked string [[instrument]], closely related to the [[guitar]]. See [[double bass]] for the traditional bowed string instrument. A bass guitar can be distinguished from a standard guitar by the fact that it almost always has four strings, and four tuning pegs at the top of the neck, usually along one side or with two on each side directly opposed. The bridge is also much closer to the bottom of the body to accommodate the longer strings. [[acoustic bass guitar|Acoustic basses]] feature a larger resonator body to better amplify lower frequencies and a longer neck compared to their [[acoustic guitar]] counterparts. Electric bass guitars use pickups to sense and convert string vibrations into electromagnetic impulses. Often they are based on existing [[electric guitar]] designs but nearly always have four or [[5-string_bass_guitar|five strings]] as opposed to guitar's six, although there are some [[6-string_bass_guitar|six string models]]. Electric basses, especially those equipped with active pickups, tend to have more control knobs than an electric guitar with an equal number of pickups. Do not tag [[bass guitar]]s as regular [[guitar]]s. h4. Examples * !post #8816761: Electric bass guitar * !asset #25918782: [[acoustic_bass_guitar|Acoustic bass]] * !post #9124674: [[5-string_bass_guitar|5-string bass]] * !post #9365772: [[6-string_bass_guitar|6-string bass]] * !post #9035829: [[headless instrument|Headless]] and [[fretless bass guitar]] * !post #5938064: [[PJ Bass]] h5. Commonly tagged models * !post #8805441: [[Fender Jazz Bass]] * !post #8821317: [[Fender Precision Bass]] * !post #7966014: [[Music Man Stingray]] * !post #8075969: [[gibson_sg_(bass)|Gibson SG Standard Bass]]/EB * !post #2731221: [[Rickenbacker 4001]]/4003 * !post #5883931: [[Yamaha TRB]]/TRBX/RBX h4. See also * [[List of guitars]] * [[Chapman Stick (instrument)]] * [[Tag Group:Audio Tags]]

body: A [[guitar]] with more than 6 strings. The most common variants are the [[7-string guitar]] and the [[8-string guitar]].

title: moon_cell_core_(fate)
body:
The core of the Moon Cell from [[Fate/EXTRA]]. The core of the Moon Cell is a gigantic photonic crystal, about 3000 kilometers in length and using light as its storage medium, as well as all of its high-level data control systems to transmit data and system commands. The giant photonic crystal slumbering beneath the moon can be considered a supercomputer of enormous size, incredible complexity, and immeasurable processing power that was created from such nanoparticles. Although most supercomputer development was abandoned in the 2010s in favor of shifting the focus to cloud computing, the processing power of the all digital media on Earth combined cannot hope to match the capabilities of the substance. According to [[twice_h_pieceman|Twice H. Pieceman]], the Moon Cell's core is made of the purest type of photonic crystal, a material that can act like the crystals used on holography to recording media.

https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Moon_Cell
* !post #8972135

title: jeanne_d'arc_alter_(lancer)_(fate)
body:
A more somber and serious version of [[Jeanne d'Arc Alter (fate)|]] summoned by [[Chiemon (fate)|]] during the Waxing Moon Ritual in [i][[Fate/Samurai Remnant]][/i]. Unlike her Avenger counterpart, she dual-wields [[lance]]s, wears a tattered purple [[cape]], and lacks an [[ahoge]].

[spoilers]She is actually the corrupted form of the real [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]], so wished into this state by her master [[Chiemon (fate)|]]'s intense desire to wreak vengance upon the Tokugawa Shogunate overpowering her immunity to corruption. As a result, many of the advantages she would have in a typical Holy Grail War have been severely reduced.[/spoilers]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]

title: morinphen
body:
A Fiend-type [[duel monster]] from early days of the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] card game. Based on a Phyrexian card from [[Magic: the Gathering]] called Morinfen.

It gained its [[meme]] status in Japan as a "poster boy" for high-level, low-stat normal monster released in the early days of the game. This reputation can be likened to [[Shapesnatch]]'s in the West and Leo Wizard's in China.

title: sauravis_dragon_sage_of_the_voiceless_voice
body:
Level: 7
Attribute: Light
Type: Dragon / Effect

You can Special Summon this card (from your hand) by shuffling 2 Spells from your hand and/or GY into the Deck, including a Ritual Spell. You can only Special Summon "Sauravis, Dragon Sage of the Voiceless Voice" once per turn this way. When your opponent activates a card or effect (Quick Effect): You can return this card from the field to the hand; Special Summon 1 LIGHT Ritual Monster (Warrior or Dragon) from your hand or Deck, but shuffle it into the Deck during the End Phase of the next turn. You can only use this effect of "Sauravis, Dragon Sage of the Voiceless Voice" once per turn.

ATK: 2600
DEF: 2800

title: olivia_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Olivia[/b], known as [b]Lychee[/b] (ライチ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

This Island Kahuna is trusted like a big sister by her island's residents, thanks to her compassion and strength in battle. The jewelry shop she runs also handles fossils. Her signature Pokemon is [[Lycanroc (midnight)|]].

She is [[dark-skinned female|dark skinned]], has [[black eyes]] with [[bright pupils]], [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] fashioned with [[swept bangs]], [[pink lips]], and [[aqua nails|aqua]] [[nail polish|fingernails]] and [[toenail polish|toenails]]. She wears [[earrings]], numerous [[bangle|bangles]], [[anklet|anklets]], [[thighlet|thighlets]] and [[neck ring|neck rings]], a [[bead necklace]], numerous [[diamond (shape)|diamond-shaped]] [[gem|gems]], a [[sleeveless]] [[pink shirt|pink]] [[crop top]] that reveals [[sideboob]], [[purple shorts|purple]] [[short shorts]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[high heels]].

title: gullinbursti_(housamo)
body:
A Transient forged by the dwarves in the world of Yggdrasil. The sword he carries has the power to fell even a giant in a single swing, and a powerful Rule that grants victory to its wielder. It was originally the possession of his master, and is of such high quality that he has yet to become fully proficient in its use. His master is fated to fall in battle, but had they not given away this sword, they may have been destined for a different fate. A modest Therian, Gullinbursti does not wish for the formidable strength of the sword, but nonetheless, trains constantly to make himself worthy of bearing it. He is bewildered by those whose mindset may differ greatly from that of a boar such as himself, but still finds them fascinating.

h4.See also
* [[Tokyo Afterschool Summoners]]

h4. External links
* "Tokyo Afterschool Summoners Wiki: Gullinbursti":https://housamo.wiki/Gullinbursti

title: void_(kirby)
body:
The absolute true form of [[Void Termina]]. Ancient texts imply that he is able to reincarnate from positive or negative energy. That along with attacks during his boss fight suggest a heavy connection to, among other things, [[Dark Matter (kirby)|]], [[Zero (kirby)|]], [[Dark Mind]], and even [[Kirby]] himself. Defeating it allows the player to swap between Kirby's current appearance and the design he debuted with in [[Kirby's Dream Land]].

Void's most notable trait compared to his previous forms is [[rainbow_gradient|rainbow]] [[veins]] coursing through his body.

title: mainz_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the German light cruiser [i]Mainz[/i], as part of a collaboration with [[World of Warships]].

Originally, she is a design planned for the rest of the Admiral Hipper-class sisters that were originally planned as light cruisers before the start of the war, Seydlitz was her original name before Wargaming renamed her to Mainz. Mainz is a Light Cruiser version of the Admiral Hipper with the guns of 150mm triple guns intended and designed after the Light Cruiser Nurnberg.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a white [[military uniform]] comprising a [[white jacket]] with [[juliet sleeves]], [[black belt]], [[black gloves]], [[Iron Cross]] ornaments on her cuffs and red straps, cross [[earrings]], [[black hairband]], [[black cape]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], black [[garter straps]], [[white thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her four intended 150 mm triple gun mounts on individual animal head pieces, while she uses a [[rapier]] as her melee weapon.

Character design by [[Liduke]], voiced by [[Kaida Yuuko]].

h4. Skins

title: mirai_robo_daltanious
body:
[b]Mirai Robo Daltanious[/b] (未来ロボ ダルタニアス [i]Mirai Robo Darutaniasu[/i]), also known as [b]Future Robot Daltanious[/b], is a [[science fiction]] and [[super robot]] anime TV series which aired from 1979 to 1980 in Japan.

Nagahama Tadao influenced the series' artistry and direction, and its style resembles those of [[Choudenji Machine Voltes V]] and [[Choudenji Robo Combattler V]].

Was originally intended to appear for [[Voltron (series)|]], but would be substituted for [[Hyakujuu-ou GoLion]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Daltanious]]
* [[Shiratori Sanae]]
other_names: 未来ロボダルタニアス

title: kousoku_denjin_albegas
body:
[b]Kousoku Denjin Albegas[/b] (光速電神アルベガス, [i]Kōsoku Denjin Arubegasu[/i]), also known as [b]Lightspeed Electroid Albegas[/b], is a TV anime [[super robot]] series that aired from 1983 to 1984 in Japan, Latin America, Spain and Italy. 

There were 45 episodes aired at 25 minutes each. Other loosely translated names are [b]Arbegas[/b], [b]Arebegas[/b], [b]Lightspeed ElectroGod Arbegas[/b] and [b]Arbegas: El Rayo Custodio[/b] (Spanish for "Arbegas: The Custodian Ray").

Nearly became the third show to be encorporated into [[Voltron (series)|]], as [i]Voltron II: Defender of the Middle Universe[/i] or Gladiator Voltron, but the poor success of the [[Kikou Kantai Dairugger XV|Dairugger XV]]-based [i]Voltron I: Defender of the Near Universe [/i]led to Albegas' inclusion being scrapped and the [[Hyakujuu-ou GoLion]]-based [i]Voltron III: Defender of the Far Universe[/i] receiving newly-commissioned animation in the form of [i]Voltron: Fleet of Doom[/i].

h4. See also

* [[Albegas]]

title: hr-d3
body:
A giant [[mecha]] modeled after [[King Dedede]]. Originally set to appear in the [[kirby_for_nintendo_gamecube|now-cancelled]] [[Gamecube]] [i][[kirby_(series)|Kirby]][/i] game, it made its official debut as a boss in the [i]Kirby Quest[/i] subgame in [i][[Kirby Mass Attack]][/i]. It much-more-prominently appears in [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land]][/i] and [i][[Kirby's Return to Dream Land Deluxe]][/i] as an exclusive boss in Extra Mode right after defeating [[Metal General]] EX, as well as in The True Arena.

[spoilers]Any connections it or [[hr-h|HR-H]] may have to the Haltmann Works Company are for now left ambiguous.[/spoilers]

title: see-through_body
body:
When objects behind (and sometimes simultaneously inside) a character can be seen through a character's skin and/or clothes, either partially or wholly. This might include a visible [[exposed bone|skeleton]] and/or [[organs]].

See-through bodies might be due to character design - such as for [[ghost]] characters, [[slime girl]]s/[[slime boy|boys]], etc - or because a character is [[fading|fading away]].

If a character has an entirely different image embedded in their skin/clothes, see [[double exposure]].

Not to be confused with [[invisible man]] which is a technique used to allow clear view of sexual scenes.

h4. Examples

* !post #5545358
* !post #7594887: With [[refraction]]
* !post #4164787

h4. See also

* [[Blending]]
* [[Translucent hair]]
* [[Transparent hand]]
* [[X-ray]]

title: mobile_suit_gundam:_cucuruz_doan's_island
body:
The 15th episode of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], which later received a movie in June 2022.

The original [[Gundam]] episode is notorious for being the source of several of the most recognizable [[QUALITY]] instances from the series, and is such a sore spot for the creators that [[Tomino Yoshiyuki]] himself requested that it not be included in foreign releases of the series.

The episode was adapted into part of [[mobile suit Gundam the origin|The Origin]] from 2015 to 2019. This adaptation provided a lengthier backstory for [[Cucuruz Doan]] himself, and further context for characters involved in the original episode.

title: rat_feet
body:
Rat or mouse feet are visible. Compared to the rest of the body, they usually have less hair on them, with partial or clear skin visible. They are not hairless. Artistic representations may vary this detail and may omit the hair; this does not preclude the tag.

At the end of each toe, there are usually long nails or claws (depending on the artistic representation).

In anthropomorphic representations of rats or mice, note whether they are depicted in an animal or human form, as this will determine whether the tag applies.

title: gregor_eisenhorn
body:
Gregor Eisenhorn is an [[Inquisition_(Warhammer)|Inquisitor]] of the Ordo Xenos. Initially a Puritan of the Amalathian faction, Eisenhorn's Inquisitorial ideology would alter over the course of his career so dramatically towards the philosophy of Radical Xanthism that other members of the Inquisition consider him a possible Heretic.

Indeed, Eisenhorn has officially been considered a Traitor by the Inquisition at least twice in his Inquisitorial career, only to be proved a righteous servant of the [[Emperor of Mankind]] both times.

https://warhammer40k.fandom.com/wiki/Gregor_Eisenhorn

She wears a [[brown apron|brown]] [[vertical-striped apron]] over a [[grey kimono]], a pair of [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] and [[black sandals|black]] [[zouri]].

title: kaldor_draigo
body:
Kaldor Draigo is the current Supreme Grand Master of the [[Grey Knight|Grey Knights]] [[Adeptus Astartes|Space Marine]] Chapter.

Lost in the Realm of Chaos within the Warp for at least the last standard century, he is sometimes able to return to realspace to fight alongside his battle-brothers in the Grey Knights during particularly dangerous Daemonic incursions.

But one day, when his Chapter and the defenders of the Imperium of Man know their darkest hour, he will return to the mortal realm permanently to lead them to victory.

https://warhammer40k.fandom.com/wiki/Kaldor_Draigo

title: grey_knight
body:
The Grey Knights are a secret and mysterious Chapter of [[Adeptus Astartes|Space Marines]] specifically tasked with combating the dangerous Daemonic entities of the Warp and all those mortals who wield the corrupt power of the Chaos Gods. They were created by the Emperor with the aid of Malcador the Sigillite at the time of the Horus Heresy to serve as Humanity's greatest weapon against the threat posed by the existence of Chaos. They have the honour of being implanted with gene-seed engineered directly from the genome of the Emperor Himself.

https://warhammer40k.fandom.com/wiki/Grey_Knights

She has numerous other television drama and theatre credits.

title: scan_artifacts
body:
Artifacts made due to poor [[scan|scanning]]:

* [[binding discoloration]]: The Image gets blurry as the perspective warps to either side due to the page bending
* [[bleed through]]: Visible contour of illustrations from the opposite side of the page
* [[color halftone]]: Visible printing dots, usually in a high definition scan
* [[color issue]]: The color of the image seems far from ideal, it may be low contrast between blacks and whites, over-saturation, or even the hue shifting. Can either be the result of poor or lack of editing, deterioration of the paper
* [[crease]]: Bending marks
* [[scan dust]]: Debris opacating the original illustration

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Image composition]]
* [[Tag group:Scan]]

title: jpeg_artifacts
body:
A kind of compression artifact.

Prevalent in images uploaded from [[Twitter]] and [[Facebook]].

These can be either blockiness or mosquito noise and are usually seen in areas with high contrast, such as near lines. If in doubt, refer to some of the images with this tag. 

This tag should be used for images where these artifacts are noticeable when viewed normally, without zooming in or enhancing the contrast.

h4. Example
* !asset #22891347: An image devoid of artifacts (sourced from post #8012139)
* !asset #22891358: The same image, but with visible artifacts (sourced from post #8012103)

h4. See also

* [[tag group:image composition]]
* [[aliasing]] 
* [[duplicate]]
* [[lossy-lossless]]
* [[scan artifacts]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Compression artifact": http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compression_artifact

body:
A restraining pose where one person lies on their back with both legs raised toward their head in the [[folded]] position, and the other person places their legs on top of those legs, pressing them down from the head side to hold them in place.

title: rockman_online
body:
[b]Rockman Online[/b] was a Korean MMORPG computer game announced in June 2010.  It took place in the far future, where the characters from the [[Mega Man (classic)|]] and [[Mega Man X (series)|]] series had long since passed away, including the Maverick threat.

Believing the threat of Mavericks are gone for good, society is taken by surprise one day when a large number of Mavericks began to wreak havoc. In response, the UCA (United Continent Association), initiates the production of copies of [[X (mega Man)|]], [[Zero (mega man)|]], and [[Duo (mega man)|]], among other heroes, to combat the rampant Mavericks. The UCA went so far as to embed the DNA Souls of the original heroes onto a chip housed within the copy bodies to further enhance their abilities in an effort to make them as legitimate as possible. The Mavericks associated with [i]Rockman Online[/i] are actually rebuilt and heavily customized versions of enemies from the past, produced in a similar manner to the X, Zero, and Duo copies.

In March 2013, NeoWiz announced that Rockman Online was cancelled.

h4.External links
* "Mega Man Knowledge Base: Rockman Online":https://megaman.fandom.com/wiki/Rockman_Online
other_names: ロックマンオンライン

title: higashikata_hato
body:
Hato Higashikata is a secondary ally featured in the eighth part of the [[Jojo No Kimyou Na Bouken]] series, [[JoJolion]].
Hato is a tall young woman with straight medium hair grouped into strands held together in arrow shaped accessories. Hato wears a [[bodysuit]] with a laced collar and a spiraling [[arrow hair ornament|arrow]] that leads down her chest and points towards her groin. She constantly wears high-heeled shoes [spoilers]that serve as her primary weapons when coupled with her [[walking heart (stand)|Stand's]] ability.[/spoilers]

Hato is frequently shown in official artwork wearing a large sun hat, but this isn’t shown in the story itself.

body:
[[One Piece]] character. Also known as Shakky, is the bartender of Shakky's Rip-off Bar on the Sabaody Archipelago, where she lives with her husband [[Silvers Rayleigh]].

[spoiler]Shakky is a former empress of Amazon Lily and former captain of the Kuja Pirates from two generations before [[Boa Hancock]] and one generation after [[Gloriosa (one piece)|]].
She is also the only woman to have shown [[Brook (one piece)|]] her panties after he asked her for it.[/spoiler]
other_names: シャクヤク(ワンピース)

title: walking_heart_(stand)
body:
Walking Heart is the [[Stand (jojo)|]] of [[Higashikata Hato]], featured in the eighth part of the [[Jojo No Kimyou Na Bouken]] series, [[JoJolion]]. 

Walking Heart is an Artificial Humanoid Stand resembling its user, Hato. Its body is composed almost entirely of long, thin, rigid strands surrounding seemingly [[robot joints]]. Its face lacks a nose and mouth, having only emotionless [[compound eyes]] and long, rigid hair. Where its ears would be, there are peg-like protrusions ending in ticket-shaped polygons with a heart on the surface of each.

Much like its user, Walking Heart's feet take the appearance of high heels. On its chest is a large heart, surrounded by a smaller heart on each side and a heart-shaped collar around its neck. Around its waist is a short, patterned skirt with another heart in the middle.
other_names: ウォーキング・ハート

title: gerald_robotnik
body:
The grandfather of [[Maria Robotnik]] and [[Dr. Eggman]]. A renowned scientist who was widely acknowledged as one of the greatest scientific minds of all time, Gerald was responsible for several groundbreaking creations, such as the [[Space Colony ARK]], the [[Artificial Chaos]], the [[Chaos Drive (sonic)|]]s, the [[Biolizard]] and his greatest creation, [[Shadow the Hedgehog]].

Over fifty years prior to the events of [[Sonic Adventure 2]], Gerald was asked to lead Project Shadow, a medical program for researching immortality, which he accepted in hopes of finding a cure for a fatal illness afflicting Maria. [spoiler]Eventually, Gerald managed to create Shadow the Hedgehog, though not without drastic measures; he was taken into custody by the military when his work was deemed too dangerous. When learning that Maria had been killed by the military, Gerald slipped into madness and spent his last days plotting revenge against humanity.[/spoiler]

h4. External links

* "Sonic Fandom Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Gerald_Robotnik
other_names: ジェラルド・ロボトニック

title: kishibe_rohan_ruuvuru_e_iku
body: Rohan au Louvre, also known as Rohan at the Louvre, is a one-shot written by [[Hirohiko Araki]] starring [[Kishibe Rohan]]. Two original plates from the one-shot were originally featured at the [[louvre pyramid|Louvre]] in the The Louvre Invites the Comics exhibit from January 22 to April 13, 2009. It was later published in Ultra Jump between March 19 and May 19, 2010 split in three parts. Though it was released as a standalone publication, the one-shot was later categorized as an episode of the larger [[Kishibe Rohan Wa Ugokanai]] spin-off series.

title: no_country_for_old_men
body: No Country for Old Men is a 2007 American neo-Western crime thriller film written, directed, produced and edited by Joel and Ethan Coen, based on Cormac McCarthy's 2005 novel. Starring [[Tommy Lee Jones]], [[Javier Bardem]], and [[Josh Brolin]], the film is set in the desert landscape of 1980 West Texas. The film revisits the themes of fate, conscience, and circumstance that the Coen brothers had explored in the films Blood Simple (1984), Raising Arizona (1987), and Fargo (1996). The film follows three main characters: Llewelyn Moss (Brolin), a Vietnam War veteran and welder who stumbles upon a large sum of money in the desert; Anton Chigurh (Bardem), a hitman who is sent to recover the money; and Ed Tom Bell (Jones), a sheriff investigating the crime. The film also stars Kelly Macdonald as Moss's wife, Carla Jean, and Woody Harrelson as Carson Wells, a bounty hunter seeking Moss and the return of the money, $2 million.

The secondary blue Ultraman of [[Ultraman Gaia (series)|]]. His human host is [[Fujimiya Hiroya]]. Agul is the manifestation of the [[ocean|sea]], much like how [[Ultraman Gaia|Gaia]] is the manifestation of the [[Earth (planet)|]]. Agul bonded with Fujimiya Hiroya to protect the Earth, but not humanity, leading to several disagreements and battles against Gaia. Eventually, Fujimiya regained his faith in humanity and fought alongside Gaia against the minions of the Radical Destruction Bringer.

title: morrigan_aensland
body:
[b]Morrigan Aensland[/b] ([b]モリガン・アーンスランド[/b]) is the de facto main character from the [[Darkstalkers]] series of fighting games.

Morrigan is a [[demon girl|succubus]] who is very vain and lives for little more than the excitement of battle. She appears as a beautiful woman with [[long hair|long]], light [[green hair]], [[large breasts]] and [[bat wings|bat-like wings]] on her back and on the [[head wings|sides of her head]], artwork tends to depict her with either [[green eyes|green]] or [[yellow eyes|yellow]] eyes. Morrigan can reshape these wings into spikes and blades when attacking her enemies, as well as using them to shield herself from enemy attacks. Her [[wings]] can also separate from her, and form into a cloud of bats. She uses a variety of magical attacks as well. Her standard outfit reveals a large amount of [[cleavage]] and [[heart cutout]] on her [[leotard]].

Originally planned to be a vampire in her debut, Morrigan's appearance made way for the popular depiction of succubi in Japanese media.

h4. Official Art
* !post #8906027
other_names: モリガン・アーンスランド

The plot of Baxingar is based in the japanese late Tokugawa period and the story of the Shinsengumi [[samurai]].

title: sisterhood_(blue_archive)
body:
In [[Blue Archive]], the Sisterhood is a major faction within Trinity whose influence is on par with that of the Tea Party and the Knight Hospitaller.

They wish for the happiness and well-being of everyone in Kivotos, but many of Trinity's students are suspicious of them. Being the successors of the infamous Justina Council of Saints, they hold their fair share of secrets; some of which may shed light on Trinity's unknown history...

[b]Being a faction tag, this should only be used when all members of the group are present and equally in focus.[/b]

h4. Members

* [[Sakurako (blue archive)|]]
* [[Mari (blue archive)|]]
* [[Hinata (blue archive)|]]

title: feng_huangyu
body:
h4. Information

Age: 45 years old (looks like 20)
Birthday: February 19th
Height: 180cm
Activity: Caster (previously), Demon
Weapon: "Butsuo" sword ("not bad", "pretty")

Strengths:hunting, fencing
Likes to: think
Does not like: rain
Character: kind, compassionate, naive, knows how to wind himself up. He improvises a lot, sometimes he loses self-control over emotions.

h4. Background
As a child, he was the kindest of his peers, aspired to unite everyone, dreamed of being friends with everyone.
As he grew older, he became a master of various arts, not inferior to anyone in skills. Everything changed after his mother's death:
his father hated his son for being practically her copy, which made Huangyu's life hell. And then,
during a rainy hunt, he died, but the dark energy granted him a second life. From now on, he is a demon whose power is capable
of collapsing mountains and making the earth shake. 
But the past "him" inside won't let this force do too much damage. Even though he doesn't always succeed.

h4. Relations
* [[Shan Qiwei|Shan Qiwei/ Шань Цивэй/ 山启伟]] - close friend
** [[Meng Guang|Meng Guang/ Мэн Гуан/ 梦光]] - likes
** [[Bao Cheng|Bao Cheng/ Бао Чэн/ 保晟]] - likes
** [[Bao Zhan|Bao Zhan/ Бао Чжань/ 保湛]] - likes
** [[Lu Huaxing|Lu Huaxing/ Лу Хуасин/ 陆化性]] - likes
* [[Hei Guanxi|Hei Guanxi/ Хэй Гуаньси/ 黑棺洗]] - unknow
* [[Shang Yangshi|Shang Yangshi/ Шан Янши/ 商阳世]] - unknow
* [[Qing Yu (char)|Qing Yu/ Цин Юй/ 青雨]] - unknow
* [[Bao Ling|Bao Ling/ Бао Лин/ 保领]] - unknow

title: shan_qiwei
body:
h4. Information

Age: 45 (looks like 25)
Date of birth: December 27
Height: 185cm
Activity: Caster
Weapon: "Chenmo" Sword ("silence")

Strengths: Healing and Conjuring
Loves: Good wine
Dislikes: stupid questions
Character: calm, reasonable. He can speak bluntly, is quite quick-witted, and has a good imagination.

h4. Background
Background: Shan Qi Wei's mother was a strict woman and very demanding, which cannot be said about her father. Mats kept telling him that it was worth being the best, otherwise no one would love him, because of this, at first he had the one. excellent student syndrome. And she said they could just use him if he wasn't smarter. Because of this, the child grows up cautious towards others, but does not lose faith in the good in people, Later, thanks to Feng Huangyu, he copes with distrust, and then completely accepts himself along with his failures, which helps him grow. More than anything, she always wants to see Feng Huangyu happy.

h4. Relations

title: coyote_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

One of the few Friends to have obtained a redesign after the release of the original game which is first displayed as a card for Bushiroad's ChaosTCG. There, she fully embraces the image of [[wile e coyote|Wile E. Coyote]] with her new outfit and design (as well as a more explicit rivalry with [[Greater Roadrunner (kemono friends)|]]).

On December 4, 2021 she was debuted as one of the [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]s of [[Kemono Friends V Project]], and is currently the only member of the group that primarily streams in English.

On April 11th, 2025, she has "announced":https://x.com/Coyote_KEMOV/status/1910704587738407276 that she will be graduating from KemoV at the end of May, date 28th May was the last stream

title: kamisama_minarai:_himitsu_no_cocotama
body:
"Kamisama Minarai: Himitsu no Cocotama (Hepburn: Kamisama minarai Himitsu no Kokotama, "Cocotama: Secret Apprentice Gods") is a fantasy comedy anime series produced by OLM, Inc., based on the Cocotama House Series of toys created by Bandai. The series is directed by Norio Nitta and written by Michihiro Tsuchiya (Mirmo De Pon!, PriPara, Cross Game) with character designs by Shinobu Ookawa. The series began airing on all TXN stations in Japan on October 1, 2015, replacing Tamagotchi! on its initial timeslot. The series uses a few elements from Shinto Animism, regarding the Cocotamas." [1]

title: tanya_degurechaff_(sleepwalker)
body:
A version of [[Tanya Degurechaff]] made by a 19-year-old Ukrainian FPV Drone operator who went by the callsign [b]Sleepwalker[/b]. He fell in Krynky, Kherson Oblast on May 29th 2024.

Like her creator, she belongs to the Ukrainian [[35th Marine Brigade]], whose [[tryzub|patch]] she proudly adorns on her [[shoulder patch|sleeve]]. She is often depicted in a [[digital camouflage]] [[military uniform]], either commanding an [[fpv drone]] with her [[controller]] or holding a [[handgun]] with a [[stocked handgun|stock]]

title: chromatic_aberration
body:
An effect where the edges of an image have a colored, blurry halo or fringe. The RGB color channels appear noticeably offset from one another.

In photography, chromatic aberration is caused by a defect of the camera lens. The lens refracts light of different wavelengths (colors) slightly differently (technically speaking, the index of refraction of a lens material varies depending on the wavelength), causing the colors to become out of focus.

In digital art, chromatic aberration is used to simulate a photographic look or for artistic effect. In small amounts it can increase realism; in greater amounts it can create a sense of motion (similar to [[motion blur]]), convey a chaotic environment, or indicate anxiety, paranoia, or mental derangement. In excessive amounts it can induce eyestrain.

h4. Examples

* !post #2143879
* !post #7094287
* !post #6177381
* !asset #22800591

h4. See also

* [[anaglyph]]
* [[drop shadow]]
* [[film grain]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[soft focus]]
* [[heavy chromatic aberration]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chromatic aberration":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chromatic_aberration
* "Photography Life: What is Chromatic Aberration?":https://photographylife.com/what-is-chromatic-aberration

title: space_colony_ark
body:
A large, moon-like [[space habitat|space colony]] that appears in the [[sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. 
Before its shutdown, weapons of mass destruction were developed in its top secret research facilities, including the Eclipse Cannon, said to be able to destroy planets when at full capacity. It is also the birthplace of [[Shadow the Hedgehog]], 50 years prior to the events of [[Sonic Adventure 2]].

title: bubbly_voyage_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it gives [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] the ability to double jump and hover/float for a limited distance.

The outfit includes a [[short_dress|short]], [[layered_dress|layered]] [[blue_dress|blue dress]]. The dress is trimmed with white [[frills]] around the skirt and has a [[back_ribbon|ribbon trailing from the back]]. The dress and ribbon are [[striped_dress|both]] [[striped_ribbon|striped]] and the dress has a [[bubble_print|bubble pattern]]. Beneath the dress is a pair of blue and white [[bloomers]]. The outfit also has [[short_sleeves|short]] [[detached_sleeves|detached]] [[frilled sleeves]], [[ankle socks|short]] [[frilled socks]], [[black_footwear|black]] [[mary janes|mary jane]] [[high heels]], [[frilled wrist cuffs]], a [[frilled choker]] with a dark blue or black [[bow_choker| bow]], a [[white_hat]] with a [[blue bow]], and a small gold [[hair ornament]] shaped like a pair of bunny ears. The hairstyle for the outfit is [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde_hair]] tied up into two low-hanging [[hair rings]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a primarily green color scheme.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25982210
* !asset #25982216: Bubbly Voyage: Spring
* !asset #25997250: Bubbly Voyage: Mountgale

title: scott_pilgrim_(series)
body:
[b]Scott Pilgrim[/b] is a series of graphic stories by Bryan Lee O'Malley. 

The series is about [[Scott Pilgrim]], a slacker and part-time young musician (and occasional "hip street fighter") who lives in Toronto and plays bass guitar in the band [i]Sex [[Bob-Omb]][/i]. 

The comic has several classic video game references in its plot. The author has cited that the game [[Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari]] (known outside Japan as [i]River City Ransom[/i]) had a huge influence on it.

A film adaptation of the series titled [[Scott Pilgrim vs the World (movie)|]] and starring actor Michael Cera in the title role was released in August 2010.  A video game of the same name developed by Ubisoft for PlayStation Network and Xbox Live Arcade was released the same month. An anime adaptation by [[Science SARU]] would release over a decade later in 2023 on [[Netflix]]. The animation, titled [[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off]], is notable for featuring the original movie cast reprising their roles.

h4. Characters

h6. Main

* [[Scott Pilgrim]]
** [[Scott Pilgrim (prototype)]]
** [[Future Scott Pilgrim]]

body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it is used by [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to shoot energy blasts to fight enemies and collect essences. It can be acquired for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[white_dress|white]] [[halter dress]] which fades to green around the skirt and has ribbons trailing from the back, [[detached_sleeves|detached]] [[puffy long sleeves]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel sandals|high heel]] [[cross-laced sandals]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[low-braided long hair]]. Accessories for the outfit include a golden headband of branches and flowers, resmebling a [[laurel crown]], and a pair of golden [[crescent earrings|crescent moon earrings]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a white dress that fades to blue, and black hair.

title: valorant
body:
A free-to-play hero-based first-person tactical shooter released by [[League of Legends]] developer Riot Games in 2020. The game was highly anticipated leading up to its release, since it is the first major PC game Riot has released since LoL launched in 2009. Valorant quickly shot up to the number one spot on [[Twitch.tv|Twitch]] streaming during its open beta, and has been compared to games such as [[Overwatch]] and [[Apex Legends]] for its roster of colorful heroes with distinct abilities, as well as [[Counter-Strike (series)|]] for its objective-based tac-shooter gameplay.

title: full_nelson
body:
A wrestling hold in which both arms are wrapped under the opponent's armpits and the hands are held on the back of the neck. Used as a finishing move by [[WWE]] wrestler Bobby Lashley and WWE alumnus Chris Masters, calling their versions, the "Hurt Lock" and "Master Lock" respectively.

Most often seen with the [[reverse suspended congress]] [[sex]] position, with the person being [[folded]] and held with their legs bent back instead of their arms.

This appears very similar to the lesser-used [[locked legs]] restraining pose, but the restrainer is using their own legs to pin their opponent's legs, not their arms.

h4. See also

* [[choke hold]]: another way to restrain someone’s head using arms
* [[folded]]
* [[Tag group:Sexual positions]]

The outfit includes a [[short_dress|short]] [[blue dress]] decorated with a [[constellation_print|celestial motif]]. The top portion of the dress is covered by a white, [[frills|frilled]] garment with [[puffy sleeves]], while the skirt portion of the dress is puffy and resembles a pair of bloomers. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[long_hair|long]], [[wavy_hair|wavy]], [[blue hair]] styled into [[twintails]]. Accessories for this outfit include several [[star_hair_ornament|star-shaped hair accessories]] and a flat, six-pointed [[white hat]] with [[pom_pom_(clothes)|pom poms]] dangling from each point.

It has an alternate colored evolution that is primarily yellow and orange.

title: roux_louka
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] franchise. She is a supporting character in the [[Gundam ZZ]] series from 1986. Voiced by [[Matsui Naoko]].

[b]Roux Louka[/b] is a young [[AEUG]] Newtype [[pilot]] member of the [[Argama]]'s [i][[Gundam Team]][/i] where she operates the [[zeta_gundam_(mobile_suit)|Zeta Gundam]] [[Mobile Suit]] during "The First [[Neo Zeon]] War" (U.C. 088). 

As a transfer MS operator Roux is the only member of the team who was not part of [[Judau Ashta]]'s band of scavengers. She is also considered by [[Bright Noa]] to be the most experienced MS pilot of the entire group.

Some fans give her the affectionate nickname [i]"Blueberry Yogurt"[/i].

title: loading_icon
body:
A loading icon, also called a [b]throbber[/b], is an animated graphic meant to show that a computer is performing some task in the background. The most general type takes the form of a spinning wheel, usually a series of lines or dots arranged in a circle which light up in sequence. Some OS-specific types include macOS's spinning pinwheel and [[microsoft windows|Windows]]' blue circle and rotating hourglass.

h4. See also
* [[buffering]]
* [[loading screen]]
* [[progress bar]]

h4. External Links
* "Throbber (Wikipedia)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Throbber]

title: zentreya_(cowboy_bikini)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Zentreya]], and her 2nd as part of her [[Zentreya (dragon)|dragon]] appearance, debuting in late June 2023.

It is a [[cowboy western|cowboy]]-style bikini set, consisting of a [[cowboy hat]], a [[brown vest|brown]] [[vest|cowboy vest]], [[blue shorts|blue]] [[short shorts]], a [[red scarf]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[black belt]] with her [[gecko zen|Gecko forms]] face on it and a [[american flag bikini]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6445698: Reference sheet (1)
* !post #6445704: Reference sheet (2)

title: zentreya_(dragon)_(1st_costume)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[VShojo]]'s [[Zentreya]], and her 1st as part of her [[zentreya (dragon)|dragon]] appearance.

It consists of a [[black vest|black]] [[leather vest]] and [[black shorts|black]] [[shorts|jean shorts]] (in her 2D model they're replaced by a [[black skirt]]), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots|thigh]] [[high heels|high-heel]] [[boots]] and a [[bikini top only|bikini top]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[red hair]] that she often wears in a [[ponytail]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8278409: Profile (1)
* !post #4476604: Profile (2)

title: zentreya_(cyborg)
body:
The 3rd version of [[Zentreya]], rendering her a [[cyborg]], debuting in May 2022 in 2D and July in 3D.

Unlike her [[zentreya (commander)|previous]] [[zentreya (dragon)|versions]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] and [[yellow eyes]] with [[slit pupils]].

title: zentreya_(dragon)
body:
The 2nd version of [[Zentreya]], appearing in October 2020, rendering her as a [[dragon girl]].

In her dragon form, she has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] which she wears in a [[ponytail]], [[yellow eyes]], [[dragon horns]], [[dragon tail]] and [[dragon wings]]. She also has a [[chibi]] in this form which fans have dubbed "[[Gecko Zen]]".

title: hotpot
body:

title: gundam_gihren_no_yabou
body:
[b]Mobile Suit Gundam: Gihren’s Greed[/b] ([i][b]Kidou Senshi Gundam Gihren no Yabou[/b][/i]) is a series of turn-based strategy [[video game]]s developed and published by [[Bandai]], based on the popular [[Gundam]] franchise. 

It takes its gameplay style from the SD Gundam game series and adds political and military management to [[mobile suit gundam|"The One Year War"]]. The first game in the series, "Gihren's Greed", was released in 1998 for the [[Sega Saturn]] game console.

The title is derived from that of [[Nobunaga no Yabou|Nobunaga's Ambition]], although the English title uses a different translation for the word [i]yabou[/i].

h4. See also

* [[SD Gundam G-Generation]]
other_names: 機動戦士ガンダムギレンの野望

body: A type of [[trowel]] used by masons for leveling, spreading, or shaping substances such as cement, plaster, or mortar, as well as for breaking bricks to shape them or smoothing a mould.

title: rippling_serenity_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to fish. It can be acquired by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[blue shirt]] with a fish design printed on it, a [[white jacket]], [[white pants]] with a [[brown belt]], a [[white hat]] tied around the chin with a [[ribbon]], [[blue boots]], [[long_gloves|long]] [[blue_gloves|blue]] [[fingerless gloves]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is just [[short_hair|short]] [[brown hair]]. The accessories included with this outfit are a [[brown bag]] and blue [[fish earrings]].

This outfit has an alternate color evolution which is mostly black.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25991347
* !asset #25991350: Rippling Serenity: Dream
* !asset #25991353: Rippling Serenity : Sunset

title: hiphighs
body: Legwear that reach all the way up to the crotch or the hips. A higher reaching version of [[thighhighs]]. Not to be confused with [[pantyhose]], which also cover the crotch area, unlike hiphighs. Commonly seen with the [[reverse bunnysuit]].

title: the_tasmanian_devil
body:
The Tasmanian Devil, often shortened to Taz, is a [[Looney Tunes]] character.
Robert McKimson designed the character after the real-life [[Tasmanian devil]], an animal native to [[Australia]], and the Tennessee Top of American folklore; however, the only real similarity between the real-life marsupial and Robert's beast is their ravenous appetite. In fact, this appetite is Taz's main characteristic. The Devil devours everything in sight, including boulders, trees, shrubs, and hills, all the while whirling about like a miniature cyclone that sounds like a dozen motors all whirring in unison.
other_names: タズマニアン・デビル

title: pepe_le_pew
body: Pepé Le Pew is an animated character from the Warner Bros. [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies series of cartoons, introduced in 1945. Depicted as a [[France|french]] striped [[skunk]], Pepé is constantly on the quest for love.

title: marvin_the_martian
body: Marvin the Martian is an [[alien]] character from the [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies series. He frequently appears as a villain in cartoons and video games, he wears a Roman soldier's helmet and a [[skirt]].
other_names: マービン・ザ・マーシャン

title: yosemite_sam
body: Yosemite Sam is a cartoon character in the [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies series of short films produced by Warner Bros. His name is taken from Yosemite National Park in California. He is an adversary of [[Bugs Bunny]] and his archenemy alongside [[Elmer Fudd]]. He is commonly depicted as a mean-spirited and extremely aggressive, gunslinging outlaw or cowboy with a hair-trigger temper and an intense hatred of rabbits, Bugs in particular. In cartoons with non-Western themes, he uses various aliases, including "Chilkoot Sam" (named for the Chilkoot Trail; Sam pronounces it "Chilli-koot") and "Square-deal Sam" in 14 Carrot Rabbit, "Riff Raff Sam" in Sahara Hare, "Sam Schultz" in Big House Bunny, "Seagoin' Sam" in Buccaneer Bunny, "Shanghai Sam" in Mutiny on the Bunny, "Von Schamm the Hessian" in Bunker Hill Bunny, "Baron Sam von Schpamm" in Dumb Patrol, and many others. During the golden age of American animation, Yosemite Sam appeared as antagonist in 33 animated shorts made between 1945 and 1964.

body:
A limited time 4-star outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. It could only be acquired by purchasing it from the cash shop.

The outfit includes a [[long_dress|long]] [[strapless dress]] colored in a [[gradient_dress|gradient]] from light to dark [[blue_dress|blue]] and decorated with ornate patterns and gold [[jewelry]], a white [[stole]], and an almost floor length [[see-through_veil|transparent]] [[white veil]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[long_hair|long]] [[wavy_hair|wavy]] [[brunette hair]] with [[long sidelocks]] and a [[braid]] that crosses the forehead.

It has an alternate color evolution with a dark purple dress, purple veil, and blue hair.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25991058
* !asset #25991128: Moonlight Oath: Woods
* !asset #25991140: Moonlight Oath: Scarlet Tears

title: sylvester_(looney_tunes)
body: Sylvester J. Pussycat Sr. is a fictional character, an anthropomorphic [[cat]] in the [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies series of cartoons. Most of his appearances have him often chasing [[Tweety Bird]], [[Speedy Gonzales]], or Hippety Hopper.
other_names: シルベスター・キャット

title: tweety_bird
body: Tweety is a yellow canary in the Warner Bros. [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies series of animated cartoons. His characteristics are based on Red Skelton's famous "Junior the Mean Widdle Kid." He appeared in 46 cartoons during the golden age, made between 1942 and 1964.

title: human
body:
Do not use.

Most characters are human, so this tag is useless.

Fantasy copyrights which feature humans as a visual minority receive their own unique tags: [[FINAL FANTASY XI]]'s [[Hume]], [[FINAL FANTASY XIV]]'s [[Hyur]], [[Warcraft]]'s [[Human (Warcraft)|]], [[Ken to Mahou to Gakuen Mono]]'s [[Human (Totomono)|]], [[Lineage 2]]'s [[Human (Lineage 2)|]]'s, [[Saga 2]]'s [[Human (Saga 2)|]], etc.

title: invisible
body:
When a character is completely transparent and cannot be seen by either the viewer or another character. Their clothes may or may not be invisible as well.

If a character is not fully invisible but instead partially [[transparent]], then tag as [[transparent]]. If clothes are partially transparent, use [[see-through clothes]].

h4. See Also
* [[disappearance outline]]
* [[implied invisibility]]
* [[translucent]]
* [[unusually visible]]
* [[x-ray]]

title: dotted_line
body:
A continuous line that is broken up into smaller dots or dashes.

Sometimes used to mark a [[cut-here line]].

h4. See also

* [[Disappearance outline]]

body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to fix various electrical devices by playing a simple wire puzzle minigame. It can be acquired for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes an [[orange jumpsuit]] accented with green, [[green shoes]], [[green gloves]], [[orange-tinted_eyewear|orange-tinted]] [[goggles]], and [[electrical wire]] worn as [[earrings]]. The hairstyle for the outfit is [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a white, pink, and blue color scheme.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25990828

* !asset #25990846: Fully Charged: New Light

title: rosalina_(chef)
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Rosalina]] in [[Mario Kart Tour]], dressing her as a [[chef]]. She wears a [[grey shirt]] with [[long sleeves]] and a [[medium skirt|medium]] [[vertical-striped skirt|vertical-striped]] [[blue skirt]] with a [[frilled apron|frilled]] [[white apron]] with [[buttons]] over it, along with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[waist bow]]. Also wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[chef hat]] with a [[star hat ornament]], a [[grey pantyhose]], and a pair of [[white boots]]. Often depicted holding a [[cooking pot]].

title: dr._daisy
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Daisy]] introduced in [[Dr. Mario World]], dressing her as a [[doctor]]. Daisy ditches her crown and wears a [[yellow coat|yellow]] [[lab coat]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[blouse]] and an [[orange skirt]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]]. She also has on a pair of [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]] and has a [[stethoscope]] around her neck.

title: nana_asteria
body:
An Australian [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual YouTuber]] with a [[space]] theme, briefly becoming a member of [[PRISM Project]]'s final generation.

h4. Appearance
[tn] See post #7264051[/tn]

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair|purple]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[gradient hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. For her default outfit, she wears [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[white jacket]] worn over a [[white dress|white]] [[pleated dress]], [[asymmetrical legwear|asymmetrical]] [[white thighhighs|white]] and [[blue thighhighs]] and [[white boots|white]] [[platform heels|platform-heel]] [[thigh boots]].

title: souya_ichika_(1st_costume)
body:
The default costume of formerly [[Animare]], now [[Nanashi Inc.]]'s [[Souya Ichika]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Ichika_Souya/status/1226814963005542401] (4th image).

She has [[short hair]] and wears a [[blue scarf|blue]] [[polka dot scarf]], a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[blue dress]], a [[white vest]] with [[buttons]] and a [[name tag]], [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[white sleeves]], [[blue thighhighs|blue]] [[two-tone thighhighs|and]] [[white thighhighs]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[sneakers]].

body:
The default costume of [[Nijisanji]]'s [[Aiba Uiha]], as seen in post #3581607.

It is an [[idol clothes|idol costume]] consisting of a [[double-breasted]] [[white dress]] top with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a blue [[feathers|feather]] accessory, a [[blue shirt]] underneath with a matching [[ascot]], a [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[blue skirt]] with a [[blue flower]], blue [[kneehighs]], [[white shoes]], [[white gloves]], and blue [[hair bow]]s.

body:
The original default costume of VTuber [[Kaneko Lumi]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/XI_HO_/status/1419208594927415296], which she had until December 2022 when it was replaced with a [[kaneko lumi (3rd costume)|new default costume]].

She wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[hooded jacket]], a [[black tank top]], [[black pants|black]] with a [[cleavage cutout]], [[white gloves]] [[black pants|black]] half-pants a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]], and [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]].

title: kaneko_lumi_(2nd_costume)
body:
The second [[official alternate costume|costume]] of VTuber [[Kaneko Lumi]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/k1rri_desu/status/1458641709420605442].

She wears a [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]] with a [[navel cutout|navel]] and [[cleavage cutout]], [[white cape]], [[white gloves]] and [[white oots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyle]], she has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] done in a [[double bun]] with [[twintails]].

title: dr._peach
body: An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Princess Peach]] for [[Dr. Mario World]], dressed up as a [[doctor]]. In this costume, Peach wears her hair up in a [[ponytail]], and wears a pink [[lab coat]] with a [[stethoscope]] over her neck. Along with it, she wears a [[white shirt]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[miniskirt]] held in place with a [[pink belt]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]]. Often depicted holding a [[clipboard]].

title: floral_memory_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it enables [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to fly over vast distances, but only in specific areas of the world map. It can be acquired by players for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[layered_skirt|layered]] [[high-waist skirt]] decorated with [[floral print]] and a [[back bow]], a [[white_shirt|white]] [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] [[frilled shirt]], [[pantyhose]] that are colored in a [[gradient_legwear|gradient]] from dark blue to gray, [[short_gloves|short]] [[black_gloves|black]] [[frilled gloves]] with [[pearl bracelets]], and [[black_footwear|black]] [[high heels]]. The hairstyle for the outfit is a [[very long hair|very long]] [[gray_hair|gray]] [[high ponytail]] with a black [[hair bow]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a primarily orange and black color scheme, dark brunette hair, and diamond pattern with fruit print on the skirt.

h4. Appearance

Characters from [[Helldivers (series)|Helldivers series]]. They are soldiers of the Super Earth Armed Forces (SEAF).

Portrayed as soldiers wearing [[military uniform]] consisting of [[white shirt]], [[body armor]], [[black gloves]] and [[helmet]] with [[goggles]].

title: hair_ornament
body:
An accessory worn in the hair for decoration or ornamentation purposes.

Accessories used to tie or hold the hair together, such as bows or ribbons, are not considered to be hair ornaments. Hair ornaments are strictly decorative.

h4. See also

* [[hat ornament]]
* [[tag group:attire]]

title: long_sleeves
body:
Sleeves that cover the arms to at least the wrists. 

[[Detached sleeves]] may still apply if the sleeves begin at least from the middle of upper arms.


h4. See also

* [[Hands in opposite sleeves]]
* [[Oversized clothes]]
* [[Short sleeves]]
* [[Short over long sleeves]]
* [[Sleeveless]]
* [[Three-quarter sleeves]]
* [[Sleeves past wrists]]

title: absurdres
body:
Short for "absurd resolution," very high resolution images.
An image with this tag should be at least 3200 pixels wide or 2400 pixels tall.  Approximately equivalent to {{mpixels:>=7.7}}.

[i]Note: This tag is [[help:autotags|automatically]] added to images.[/i]

h4. Image sizes

* [[lowres]] (500×500 or smaller)
* no resolution tag (larger than 500x500 and smaller than 1600x1200)
* [[highres]] (at least 1600×1200)
* [[absurdres]] (at least 3200×2400)
* [[incredibly absurdres]] (any dimension over 10000)

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Image Composition]]
* [[Tag Group:Metatags]]

title: white_background
body:
Backgrounds that are completely or predominantly [[white]] in color. Can also apply to [[gradient background]] in conjunction with another background color.

When completely white and solid, it is also a [[simple background]], which is often used for character designs.

When tagging, make sure to view the original image, as images with [[transparent background]]s are previewed with a white background.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Backgrounds]]
* [[White]]

title: jewelry
body:
Any decorative adornments worn on a person made from various metals, [[gem|gemstones]], shells and beads. Its purpose is to enhance the wearer's appearance, although there are practical-usage pieces such as medic-alert bracelets and military dog tags.

h4. See also

title: bare_shoulders
body:
When shoulders are exposed, as part of clothing design, pulling/falling down, or other. Bare shoulders are especially prominent in clothes that are [[sleeveless]], [[strapless]], or have low and wide-cut necklines (ie. [[off-shoulder shirt]]).

Do not use when [[nude]], [[topless male]] or [[topless female]] applies.

Use [[single bare shoulder]] when only one shoulder is exposed.

h4. See also

* [[Bare arms]]
* [[Bare legs]]
* [[Bare back]]
* [[deltoids]]
* [[Off shoulder]]
* [[Tag group:Shoulders]]

title: cleavage
body:
The depression or valley created between a woman's [[breasts]] via partial exposure of the chest.

In anime, video games, and art, the cleavage is a popular method of adding some sexual appeal to the character. It should be noted that the cleavage is sometimes shown on characters as merely a curved line, while other times it has an extra, smaller line on the end, making the shape of a "Y" at the top of the depression.

The opposite is [[breasts apart]].

h4. See also

* [[cleavage cutout]]
* [[pectoral cleavage]]  (the male equivalent)
* [[see-through cleavage]]
* [[sideboob]]
* [[underboob]]
* [[underboob cutout]]
* [[downblouse]]
* [[Tag Group:Breasts Tags]]
* [[Tag Group:Body Parts]]

body:

It still counts if minor appendages or accessories aren't fully in frame, such as hair, clothing, wings, or tails.

It doesn't count if the character is far away or doesn't take up most of the frame. See [[wide shot]] or [[very wide shot]] instead.

title: churchill_(tank)
body:
The Tank, Infantry, [b]Mk IV (A22) "Churchill"[/b] was a British heavy infantry [[tank]] used in [[World War II]], best known for its heavy armour, large longitudinal chassis with all-around tracks with multiple bogies, and its use as the basis of many specialist vehicles. It was one of the heaviest Allied tanks of the war.

h4. Variants 

* [[Churchill AVRE]] Variant where the main gun was replaced with a 230mm spigot mortar, to be used by the Royal Engineers to clear obstacles. 
* [[Churchill Crocodile]] Variant where the hull-mounted machine gun was replaced with a flamethrower, it's fuel carried in a carriage towed behind the tank. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Ground Vehicles]]
* [[Girls und Panzer]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Churchill tank":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Churchill_tank
* GuP website: "Churchill Mk. 7":http://girls-und-panzer.jp/mecha_mk7.html
